## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 243, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 4 (Extended)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 277, 905, 293]]<|/det|>
0580/42  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 302, 904, 317]]<|/det|>
May/June 2021  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[740, 326, 904, 342]]<|/det|>
2 hours 30 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 371]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 400, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: Geometrical instruments  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 855, 621]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You may use tracing paper.- You must show all necessary working clearly.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.- For \(\pi\), use either your calculator value or 3.142.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 212, 665]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 730, 698]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 130.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<label>1</label>

<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 442, 89]]<|/det|>
A 2.5-litre tin of paint costs \(\) 13.50\$ .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 87, 447, 104]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 335, 552, 352]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 458, 573, 476]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 551, 405, 570]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 567, 838, 586]]<|/det|>
The length of the wall is \(20.5 \text{m}\) and the height is \(2.4 \text{m}\), both correct to 1 decimal place.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 597, 544, 616]]<|/det|>
One litre of paint covers an area of exactly \(10 \text{m}^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 629, 920, 663]]<|/det|>
Calculate the smallest number of 2.5-litre tins of paint she will need to be sure all the wall is painted.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 117, 920, 152]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 416, 623, 437]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 490, 692, 521]]<|/det|>
[The volume, \(V,\) of a pyramid is \(V = \frac{1}{3}\times\) area of base \(\times\) height.]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 514, 415, 532]]<|/det|>
[Density = mass \(\div\) volume]
